CollegeName: Washington University of Science and Technology
Facebook: After a thorough search of the Washington University of Science and Technology's official website (wust.edu) and multiple search engine queries, an official Facebook URL is not explicitly stated on the university's website.
CoursesAndGrades: Washington University of Science and Technology (WUST) does not explicitly state detailed course and grade requirements for admission on its official website, wust.edu.
AdditionalInformation: All applicants must complete an online learning assessment tool to evaluate their technical skills and readiness for distance education. For applicants with degrees from outside the United States, a formal degree evaluation from a NACES member is required to determine equivalency to a U.S. degree. Additionally, a course-by-course degree evaluation is necessary for those wanting to transfer credits from an international institution.
TuitionFees: Null. The requested breakdown of tuition fees for "Resident" and "Non-Resident/Supplemental Tuition" for undergraduate and graduate programs is not explicitly stated on the Washington University of Science and Technology's website in the specified format.
IsLSATRequired: After a thorough review of the official website of the Washington University of Science and Technology (wust.edu), there is no explicit statement regarding a requirement for the Law School Admission Test (LSAT) for any of its programs.
IsPTERequired: I was unable to find any explicit mention of the PTE (Pearson Test of English) being a requirement for admission to the Washington University of Science and Technology on its official website (wust.edu) based on the conducted searches.
IsTOEFLIBRequired: I was unable to find any explicit statement on the Washington University of Science and Technology's official website (wust.edu) regarding a requirement for the TOEFL iBT exam. My search for information on English proficiency and admission requirements for international students did not yield any specific documents outlining this as a necessity.
